name: places/ChIJeadgigj2wokRRh-fwvYFj-c
adrFormatAddress: 2167 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text: This is a full-service laundromat with well-maintained machines. I've been patronizing this business for several years. However, one of the young women charged me $.50 for a much-needed plastic bag. My liquid sanitizer was leaking from the bottom, and I asked for a bag. She was very reluctant to give it to me until I said I'll pay for it. My family and I have spent hundreds of dollars in this place. Also, this woman, in particular caters to the Spanish-speaking customers. She talks and laughs with them, while her DEMEANOR is quite DIFFERENT with African Americans like myself. Somebody needs to talk to her because it's clear that SHE doesn't like BLACK PEOPLE. The other staff members are much friendlier and more helpful.

originalText.text: Wash and fold service was wonderful. Quick turnaround time and friendly staff.

text.text: Wash and fold service was wonderful. Quick turnaround time and friendly staff.

originalText.text: New washing machines, please! Competition is in the neighborhood! Laundry card only! The store is kept clean and management is easy to contact by phone! Free laundry detergent, in case you run out of your laundry detergent. Good dryers but, stay with your clothes! God's misbehaving children are everywhere in NYC!

text.text: New washing machines, please! Competition is in the neighborhood! Laundry card only! The store is kept clean and management is easy to contact by phone! Free laundry detergent, in case you run out of your laundry detergent. Good dryers but, stay with your clothes! God's misbehaving children are everywhere in NYC!

originalText.text: The actual service on site here is amazing. They pick up and deliver your laundry within a day. However, the management is rude and frankly, prejudice. As a young black women, I was profiled and the manager assumed I was trying to scan them. I mistakenly typed the last digit of my card number wrong, and was contacted a week later after receiving a receipt from the company. The manager who contacted me, even after I told her something else must have gone wrong accused me of reporting the charge as fraud. I assured her this was not true and she insisted it was and that I needed to call my bank. I called and of course the charge wasn’t there. I called back and the manager then began to speak to me rudely (I.e. raising her voice and cutting me off) and our misunderstanding resulted in her telling me next time they’ll just call the police, followed by her cutting me off several times and hanging up on me. It doesn’t stop there sadly, she then texted me several times although I asked her to stop doing so. — Safe to say they lost a client. I do not recommend if you’re looking to use their delivery or pick up service.

originalText.text: I had a little trepidation about visiting as it looks small from outside but once you’re inside, it’s decently sized and the machines are good. You pay with a laundry card that you put cash into which is convenient, at least for me. The big one was about eight bucks but took a huge load of laundry that had been building up since I got to this neighborhood. For reference, I would say it could take on two to three full sized comforters comfortably and then there are smaller ones that are much cheaper, I’m sure. But I had a lot of clothes to get through so I didn’t even look at those. For the dryers, it’s about .25 cents for five minutes. My clothes came out feeling so clean and fresh and then the service…it was great. I was a little lost as it was my first time there but the staff noticed me figuring stuff out and stepped in to show me how it’s done. Very happy to have used this place, will definitely go back.
